The male terrier: I want to be the biggest most terrifying terrier dog ever seen he said to himself.

Without warning, the terrier was getting bigger and bigger until he was now practically looming over everything around him.

The male terrier: Huh? the terrier mumbled to himself as he now looked over his body and was amazed that he was now a giant.

Right after that he wiggled his now gigantic paw and slammed onto the city streets below with an earthquake like thud.

*THOOOOOM*

Terrier Kong: Hey now we're talking! i always wanted to wreak havoc upon an entire unsuspecting city! Make way for Terrier Kong all you expendable extras he said with a loud booming voice that everyone could hear.

And so Terrier Kong started his rampage as he began stomping throughout the city streets as the panicked citizens ran for their lives while Terrier Kong smashed one building after another until he came across two buildings that he managed to knock over with his gigantic strength

Afterwards the giant terrier had appeared where the city's bridge was, as he couldn't help but look on and smile evilly as the panicked citizens evacuated their city that was being destroyed.

Eventually, Terrier Kong made it to the top of the building after having no such luck finding a lady to snatch and sadly sat down on the top of the roof overlooking the city itself.

1131.content:
After spending its life so tiny, the sudden change in size pleased the Chihuahua. No longer at the mercy of everything else, she fully intended to enjoy her new found power. First though, the twenty foot tall dog wanted to get a whole lot bigger. With a mere thought, the Chihuahua expanded into a 500 foot tall behemoth.

"Yes! Much better!", she thought.

Before being banished to the pet store, the Chihuahua had spent some time at a human family's home. Unfortunately, the experience hadn't been so fun for the then little dog. She was punished constantly for barking, not to mention, chewing on shoes and furniture. Now though, because she was gigantic, the Chihuahua could do what she pleased without fear.

A nearby bus caught the massive dog's attention first. Bolting away in panic, the passenger vehicle couldn't hope to out run a 500 foot tall dog. With ease the Chihuahua overtook the bus, and seized it between her massive front paws. Then she reached down and grabbed the tiny human filled treat into her mouth.

Tiny screams excited the dog and she bit down through the metal with her massive teeth. The fragile bus didn't stand a chance...

Once her treat was gone, the Chihuahua decided to...

The group looked upon the god-like fox in fear. The same fox they hunted. They were probably going to die here. Then it happened. The head of their captor began to rise steadily. Was it growing again?

The captives looked around, only to watch as the ground seems to be getting closer, and the grass longer. They were shrinking! The grass slowly rose on them, from it being shoe height, to knee height, waist-height, chest height, and then finally it towered over them. The grass seemed like an endless forest to them, looming with giant creatures: Ants, bees, flies, mosquitoes, rats, and caterpillars.

They were right, they aren't going to survive this.

He easily catches up to a group of a dozen fleeing humans. They make a small snack for the behemoth lion. He spots an even larger crowd of human further ahead.

The lion runs to catch up with them, not caring about the one or two humans he crushed beneath his paws to catch up with the crowd. In fact he discovered he may have liked the feel of humans on his sensitive pads.

When he caught up to the crowd he decided to take his time and savor the taste of the humans this time. He took 3 or 4 people at a time into his maw and rolled them around on his tongue. The lion found the taste of the humans to be excellent. He decided to crush some of the humans beneath his paws in larger groups while he was eating. He really did enjoy that feeling humans made as they were crushed beneath his massive paws.

He soon decides to...
1222.title: 80 Foot Lion

12221.content:
The lion then thinks to himself that things may be better if he were even larger. So the concentrates and makes himself 300 feet tall.

He easily moves on to another crowd of humans. He tries crushing portions of the crowd again. The lion finds the feeling of crushing dozens of tiny humans even more pleasurable at this size.

He notices that he still hungry as well. So he begins licking up what is left of the crowd as well. They still try to flee, but at his size the effort is useless as he can catch up with them in a single step. The crowd is soon decimated by the lion and the lion decides to...
12221.title: Lion Rampage

122211.content:
The lion enjoyed the sheer overwhelming sense of dominance that came with his present size. He thought it would be even better to be so large that all other animals were the size of ants to him. He kept on growing until until even the elephants and giraffes in the zoo were barely distinguishable from each other.

It was time to teach the humans a lesson for keeping him captive. They had called him the king of the jungle. Now he would show them what it was like to have a lion as the king of the world.

He walked to a city he saw in the distance. There were many fleeing people in his path on the way there. The lion thought they should be honored to be crushed beneath his regal paws as he created his own red carpet. When he arrived at the city the people were already fleeing. It would have been hard to miss a 11000 foot tall lion.

The lion decided to take his fill of his subjects. He began licking the humans up. At his size it was not that difficult, his rough tongue combined with the saliva on it was able to easily pick up close to a hundred people with each lick.

He noticed some of the humans were running into their buildings. He thought they had been scared stupid if they think they can hide or seek shelter in those tiny things. It was easy enough to bite through most buildings and swallow them and the building. Some of the larger buildings required a different strategy. They would have been easy enough to knock over, the largest one was less than a tenth his height, but then getting to the pulverized humans in the rubble would have been more trouble than it was worth. He found that if he gave the buildings a few gentle wallops the humans would come flooding out.

With one of the buildings, after hitting it he placed his tongue at one of the entrances. It was actually a surprise to feel humans on it. He could not see whether it was because they were to scared to notice or if it was due to them being pushed by others who could not see where they were going. When he felt the direction of the crowd begin to reverse he drew his tongue back into his mouth and swallowed.

By the time the lion had finished there were only a few human survivors. They had either managed to flee or were good at finding places to hide. The lion wondered what he should do now that he is full.
122211.title: All Hail The King

choices: Grow the  female, cub, or other animals.
1241.content:
The female panther asks the male panther to the cub and her larger as well. The male has always liked the two of them so he complies with their wish. He makes the two of them 20 feet tall as well.

Just before they are about to leap out of the cage a couple of the zoo attendants arrive to feed the panthers. The female and cub decide to take them up on the offer. The female moves with lightning fast speed and quickly gobbles down one of the humans.

The cub decides to have a little fun with the other. The male panther laughs to himself. That human had always liked to taunt the animals in the zoo while he was alone. Now he was reduced to the play thing of a cub. The cub was batting him around playful with his paws. He would sometimes let him run off for a couple of feet before pinning him down with a paw. The cub grew bored of this after a while and finally decided to end the games. So the cub picked the man up in his jaws, chewed him up and swallowed the remains.
1241.title: Growing Family

12412.content:
The male panther had been sitting back and enjoying the show. Now that it was over he began to notice the rumbling in his own stomach. It was time to find some prey of his own. Humans had always smelled tasty to him. Thus he went in search of some of the humans that had fled his initial escape.

A large group was easy enough to find in a large stone structure in the zoo. Getting in was proving to another matter. Even at his size breaking into a thick walled stone structure was not an easy task. Now that the panther can change his own size that problem is easily solved.

The panther begins to increase his size until he is about 100 feet tall. It then easily tears the roof off of the building. Some of the people try to flee the building, but they had blocked most of the entrances with things in the building to keep the panther from getting in. The panther just straddles the building and blocks the front and back entrances with his paws encase they can get out.

With all the objects against the doors it is easy enough to begin lapping up the humans. The panther savors the taste of the first group of humans, rolling them on his tongue and and licking them against the roof of his mouth. They taste even better than he could have imagined. He then begins to devour every human within easy reach and soon the only ones left are those that had been moving the stuff away from the doors.

The panther thinks that it would be fun to play with his food a little first. He lifts up his left paw just enough to let some people think they can escape. When they try to flee he lowers his paw onto them and enjoys them struggling to remove the weight of his paw. He angles his paw so they can flee back into the building. The panther then does the same trick with his right paw except he lowers the paw completely to the ground crushing most of that group of people beneath his paw. What was left of that group fled toward the center of the building. The panther licked the remains off his paw and turned his attention to the remaining humans.

He caught all of them in his mouth. Then he just sat there and let them try to escape their pink prison. He left his teeth parted enough for some of the people to try to push their way out through his lips, but the weight of his lips was to much for the tiny humans and he eventually lowered your teeth onto them. Apparently the sound of bones being crushed (it would have been to dark to see inside his mouth) caused some of the humans to stumble to far back in his mouth and right down his throat. This caused him to gag and swallow the rest of the humans to.
12412.title: 100 Foot Panther

124121.content:
The panther is still hungry and begins to look for more humans. As he is doing so he notices a threatening looking metallic vehicle with a narrow tube attached to it. When it points at him he jumps out of the way. It emitted a loud noise and produced a ball of flame larger than his head where he had just been standing. That probably would have killed me the panther thought to himself.

He begins to make himself big enough to counter this new threat. The tank crew was amazed to see the already titanic panther soar to at least 800 feet in height. The tank fired one more shot at the panther before it was crushed by a single toe.

The shot did not do any real damage to the panther as the shot impacted the sensitive pad on his foot. It still stung though. So the panther grew himself an additional 200 feet.

The meal in his stomach did not get any larger and this left him starving. He looked around and saw that he had demolished most of the cages in the zoo and many of the animals were free. There were no humans left in the zoo though. But, at 1000 feet in height it is not that difficult to spot thousands of humans fleeing in the distance. There is not much he cannot see over now.
124121.title: Humans Strike Back

1241211.content:
Those vehicles could still kill his family. He needs to make sure they will be alright. The panther grows the female panther to 800 feet in height and the cub to 600 feet in height. He did not want them so big they would eat all of his humans.

It turned out he was worried for nothing. They each spotted different groups of humans to pursue. The panthers each wandered off after their own meals.

The male panther easily caught up to his humans. He never even had to run. He always new humans were slow creatures, but at his size they may as well have been standing still.

The panther traps the humans between buildings that he knocks over in the paths they are fleeing on. This done, he can lay down and savor his meal. He places both of his front paws on a part, applying just enough pressure not to crush them. He then laps up the portion of the crowd that is within reach of his tongue, taking hundreds of people into his maw with each lick and swallowing them. He also licks up any of the humans that had been trying to crawl over his legs. He needed to clean his legs anyways the panther thought to himself. As he stood up to move forward he crushed those beneath his paws. Then he repeated the process with the next segment of terrified humans.

When he gets to the last segment of humans he once again decides to enjoy himself. He laps them up like before, but leaves his lips parted enough to give them some light. This turns out to be a mistake as he notices a few of the people take the leap from his lips to the ground a couple hundred feet below. The panther instantly clenches his teeth, putting an end to anyone who happened to be in that location.

He did like the feeling on his tongue as the people crowded against his teeth and tried to squirm in between them. The panther decided to test their grip on his teeth. The people in the panthers maw began to claw franticly at the teeth as the panther started to slowly tilt his head back. Despite their efforts, they began to lose their grips and fell into the cavernous gullet of the monstrous black beast.

The panther was surprised he still felt a few people hanging on to his teeth when his head was tilted straight up into the air. He was starting to feel full. So he decided to make reward them for their efforts. He let them out of his mouth. The humans, no more than a dozen, were still scared and covered in panther saliva but actually were not in that bad a shape. They watch the panther depart and pass out once they can no longer feel the tremors from the panthers paws.

The panther finds what he is looking for. A nice sunny area were he can sleep of his meal. With a full belly he quickly dozes of to sleep. He does not wake for a good 12 hours. He stretches and yawns as he wakes, showing the world his building sized fangs. He then notices what must be a human army preparing to greet him.
1241211.title: Satisfying Hunger

12412111.content:
The panther was angered and puzzled that the humans would try to oppose him. They just did not behave like proper prey. He would show the humans the error of their ways himself. Just then the humans began their attack. He was surprised to find that a few of the impacts stung as they struck his fur. This only served to further enrage the panther.

The soldiers had heard of the panthers size changing ability, some had even seen it on the news as the panther had devoured the cities population, including the cameramen. But seeing it in person was a completely different thing. Nothing could have mentally prepared them for the shock of seeing the panther more than quintuple in size. They were barely prepared for the 1000 foot tall panther, and now a one mile tall panther stood before them. The idea of fighting this monster seemed as ludicrous as ants fighting an elephant. The panthers enormous paw hovered over the soldiers and began to descend. The soldiers new there was no escape as they watched the paw come down on them and they began to make out that even the hairs on the paw were thicker than trees and more than enough to crush a man.

The panther was slow to lower his paw. He wanted to make them regret opposing him. Prey should flee from the predator, not come right up to him. It was difficult for him to tell when he had finally crushed all of the humans, even with his sensitive pads. When he was sure they had all been crushed he ground the remains into paste and left it as a reminder to humans.

Now that that was over, it was a new day and time to...
12412111.title: Panther's Wrath

124121111.content:
Panthers do need a large amount of meat every day. So he goes in search of a new meal. He perks up his satellite like ears and listens. He hears many large groups of humans headed away from him. This is much more like proper prey. He begins to head for what sounds like the largest group.

As the panther approaches the group he notices they are starting to move slower and slower. He wonders why this should happen until he gets within visual range of them. He notices that as his paws hit the ground he is causing what must be small earthquakes to the humans. Many of the humans structures begin to crumble at his approach and the humans are having trouble standing, running is just not possible for them.

The panther notices that he cannot make out individual humans at his size. They would probably be safer if they disperse, he would not even notice a single human. But the humans seem to have a herding instinct, it is like they think numbers will give them a degree of safety.

He began to take the humans into his maw. From a distance the panther looked like a giant black cat lapping up a bowl of milk. Some of the humans gave up hope of escaping, after all it would only take the panther a couple of seconds to walk the same distance in a couple of seconds as Olympic runner could run in an hour. But even more people were driven on by blind panic.

The panther decided to make a game out of it. He tried to see how many humans he could fit in his mouth at the same time. A quarter of the crowd was in his mouth before they started spilling out. Some of the people in his mouth had held out hope that the panther would not swallow them, but with his curiosity satisfied those people found themselves descending the panther's gullet.

It does not take long to finish off the crowd and he is still hungry. They were only about four mouth fulls after all. He takes a moment to lay down, inadvertently crushing a couple of survivors beneath his mountain like body, and clean himself off. When he gets to his paws he discovers that he stepped on more things on his way here than he thought. Cleaning done, the panther...
124121111.title: Hungry Feline

1241211111.content:
The panther decides that his hunger supersedes everything else. It also helps that the humans are moving in such large and slow groups. To the panther it was like the humans were asking to be eaten.

The panther continued on to the next group. On his way there the panther crushed small groups of people, no more than a dozen in size. The panther did not notice or did not care about what happened to those people. He did notice groups of at least 80 or more people and licked them up and swallowed without stopping.

When he finally arrived at the next large group of humans he continued his pattern of devouring most of the crowd. He toyed with some before swallowing as before. Some of the humans did something different however. They would actually dive beneath his paws. The panther thought that they must think being crushed beneath his paws would be less painful than being digested alive.

The panther continued this pattern with most of the groups for the better part of the day. By the time his hunger was satisfied none of the humans he could detect remained. He sat down to clean himself again and made a discovery. Some of the humans that had dived under his paws had actually climbed between his toes. He shook them out of their hiding place. The violent motion killed a few, but many survived. The panther pondered what to do with the survivors and concluded that he should...
1241211111.title: On The Prowl

12412111111.content:
Turn about was fair play. The humans had kept the panther in captivity and now he would do the same with them. The panther used his paw to dig a huge trench around the humans. When the panther was finished some of the humans looked over the edge of the trench. It was a few hundred feet deep and would be difficult to climb down and then climb up the other side.

The panther had another idea to prevent escape. The people looked on in horror as the panther appeared to get larger. Then they looked around at the environment and everything looked like it was growing. They were shrinking. They were only one inch tall when the panther stopped shrinking them.

To the humans the panther looked like it 72 miles tall, far larger than any mountain. To the panther the humans were to small to see. He decided to gather some more humans to keep in the enclosure. Before he left he warned all other animals to stay away from his humans or they would be shrunk too.

The panther made a few trips, gathering humans in his mouth, shrinking them, and depositing them in their new home. He stopped when there were enough humans to be noticed by himself. Job done the panther lays down to digest his meal. He curls up around the enclosure, his body easily surrounding the entire area.

While the panther is sleeping the humans decide to...
12412111111.title: Pets

124121111111.content:
Of the 500,000 people the panther has captured on the artificial plateau around 80,000 thousand attempt an escape. The rest think it might be a good idea to try and stay on the panther's good side. They begin a long climb down the sides of the canyon. They have to stay together to help each other out since there are few expert climbers in the group. By the time they make it back up the other side of the canyon many hours have passed. Over one hundred people have died from falls off the walls and several hundred more have been injured in some way.

There is another problem now that they are on the other side though. The panther forms a barrier more impressive than any mountain. They are about to attempt to climb the panther when it begins to stir. Staying together may have helped to get across the canyon, but now it only served to make the group just large enough for the panther to notice them. The panther had been looking at just that spot as it woke, if it had not been he may have missed them.

The panther was infuriated with the speck of a group. How dare they try to escape him. He could have killed them before, but kept them safe and under his protection. With a look of disdain the panther raises his paw. The humans see the monolithic paw eclipse the sun and cower in terror. It lowers its paw and crushes the tiny speck of a group with a single city sized toe. Still angry, the panther turns its attention to the group on the plateau. It decides to...
124121111111.title: Punishment

1241211111112.content:
The panther is still furious with the humans. He begins to lower his paw on the other humans. Then he starts to calm down. These humans did stay put and had behaved themselves. He changes his mind and lowers the paw away from the humans.

The humans have backed as far away from the panther as they can. He notices this and enjoys how just standing in front of them can inspire such fear. Then he remembers that he enjoyed being petted when he was in the zoo. There may be a use for the humans that does not involve their deaths.

The people think the panther has changed its mind again when a giant paw begins to approach them. Then the paw actually lands a short distance from the humans. They start to back away from it and the panther begins to growl. The people are scared and try to back away even more and the volume of the growling grows. Some people get the clue and begin to approach the paw and the growling stops.

Pleased that the humans were able to understand his intentions, he begins to purr as the humans start to pet his paw. Even though all of them are petting his paw they just barely surround his paw. The panther lifts his paw up when he is finished, inadvertently injuring a few people that did not react fast enough.

His pleasure done, the panther decides to...
1241211111112.title: Who's The Pet?

12412111111121.content:
It has been a while since the panther has seen his family. Even though they are giants to a regular panther, they are only bugs to him and would be hard to notice. He thinks of them growing until they are half a mile tall and goes looking for them.

It takes the panther a few hours to find them. When he does he sees that the female is sleeping peacefully on a hillside and the cub is playing with the populace of a city not to far away. The cub seems unaware of its strength. It looks like it is trying to lightly bat around the humans, but it is shattering the bodies of the humans with each blow. It is also inadvertently crushing most of its playmates beneath its paws in its excitement.

The panther wakes its mate and gathers its cub. He decides to take them to see his captive humans. The cub is delighted to see the flea sized humans in the enclosure. As it is about to bat them around too the male panther stops it. The cub is a little disappointed, but decides to do something else.

The cub looks like it is going to pretend to pounce on the humans. When it is pouncing its foot slips on some debris. The humans are stunned when they see the huge body of the panther cub hurtling toward them. There is nowhere to run since the cubs body is far larger than their plateau. The cub lands on the humans with earth shattering force and when it stands back up the only thing left of the humans is a small red stain on its belly. The mother licks the ugly stain off the cubs fur.

The male panther sighs to himself. He is not to angry with the cub though. He could always gather more humans. The male decides to...

she don't like being bigger so will make herself smaller

Mother Nature tells her mirror to looks for a female tiger. So then a Image appears in the mirror of a tiger. Its laying down in a zoo. Then a ghostly figure appears in front of the tiger.

As she began to walk off there was a crunch beneath her paw. She looked down and saw she had crushed two humans. There were also a few other people scattered about who were frozen in fear at the sight of her. There was a rumble in her belly and they were making themselves easy targets. She licked the remains from her paw. When she started eating some of the people were able to break out of their paralysis and start to run.

Since they were all headed in opposite directions the tigress could not catch them all. She did manage to swallow a couple dozen though. It was a nice little snack. The sensation of eating live prey and having them struggling in her belly was an exhilarating experience for the tigress. The zoo keepers were nice enough, but they had never given her something alive before.

The tigress remembered that it was fun playing with her handlers. They looked like they were scared of her so she nuzzled and licked them to assure them she meant no harm. Some of them looked a little less tense. Now it was time to amuse herself.

She tried to lightly bat a handler. When her paw made contact she heard a snapping noise and the handler flew through the air and did not move when it landed. The tigress had forgotten just how frail humans were and how strong she was. The handler was obviously dead and the tigress decided to put the body to use and swallowed it.

Unfortunately, all the other handlers were terrified of her again. When she tried to comfort them again they backed away and tried to flee. The tigress was able to block their path and tried to think of what to do to calm them down. Then she remembered that they had always told her she was a nice big tiger. It seemed obvious that she should increase her size to impress them and thus calm them down.

The handlers did stop running when they watched the tigress growing. It was not for the reasons the tigress thought, they were just frozen with fear at the sight of a 400 foot tall tiger.

She lowered her paw on them and remembered to be much more gentle this time. The tigress rolled them around with her paw and enjoyed the felling of their flailing limps on her sensitive pads. Then she started rolling around, acting like a giant kitten, and presented her belly to the handlers to be petted. She crushed a few exhibits and people who had been hiding beneath her as she did this, but was careful to leave the handlers unharmed. Some of the handlers knew what she was doing and decided to play along rather than anger the beast.

After a while the tigress grew tired of play. She is proud of herself, none of the handlers had been killed at her new size and only a couple had been injured. The tigress wraps the handlers in her tongue and gathers them in her mouth. She can feel them struggling to get out and is amused by their efforts. The tigress then...
12521.title: Playful Feline

choices: They find a large group of humans.
125211.content:
It is about time she got back to her mate and cub the tigress thinks to herself. She takes the handlers with her. When she gets there she lowers the handlers into the enclosure. The male tiger and the cub rub against the females muzzle and then against the handlers when she lets them out of her mouth.

She then grows the male to her own size and the cub to about 80 feet in size. She moved the cub out of the exhibit when she attempted to play with the humans. The female tiger did not trust the cub to play gently with them. She then created a barrier in front of the exits from the exhibit so the humans could not escape.

All three of the tigers were hungry and it was time to hunt. The cub had just moved on to solid foods, so they could all learn to hunt together. The adults never had the chance to since they were zoo animals. The female thought it should not be that hard for her to catch something at her size. The only question would be could they catch enough for all of them.
125211.title: Family Time

125212.content:
The tigress looks down at where the handlers used to be. They had a few trays full of meat. Looks like they had been coming to feed the big cats. There was not enough food there to satisfy her monstrous appetite. The tigress thought she should let the handlers do their job and help to feed her.

For the handlers it had already been a terrifying experience. They had thought the tigress was going to accidentally crush them during her play. Now they were stuck in her mouth with her fetid carnivores breath surrounding them. When they felt her head tilting back and her tongue flexing it dashed all hope they had that the tiger was still playing with them. They were quickly pushed to the back of her mouth and into her throat. The tigress enjoyed the slight tickling sensation the humans made as they struggled to avoid their fate.

The handlers did not come close to satiating her hunger. She ate the trays of meat in front of her in one bite. The tigress was going to have to find a larger food source. But, maybe she should go back to her family first. They would definitely be hungry by now.
125212.title: Job Hazards

choices: She plays with her food first.
1252121.content:
The tigress decided that her own hunger came first. She could go back and help her family after her hunger was satisfied. Their were a few animals in the zoo that looked good and were quickly devoured by her. Her hunger was still not satisfied since even elephants were only the size of small mice to her.

Her radar like sense of hearing could hear many humans outside the zoo. The tigress ran to the closest group of humans. She had forgotten how slow most things would be to her now. When she caught up to the humans she nearly overshot them and tried to stop. A few humans were crushed beneath her paw and even more were plowed under as she slid across the concrete, her claws digging deep furrows in the ground as she attempted to stop.

Most of the humans looked confused after the tigress's mishap. She had sent a lot of debris flying around the air and was on the other side of the group by the time she stopped. There was a large dust cloud and some people did not realize they needed to flee in the other direction. Many unfortunate people ran directly toward the hungry tigress. Most did not become aware of their mistake until they were already in the tigress's mouth and heading down her throat.

The tigress noted how the humans had become confused and ran right to her. She would have to remember this trick in the future. Then again, even the humans that did flee in the right direction were easy enough to catch up with and she might not have to put in the extra effort. The dust cloud did have it draw backs. She could not see some of the humans in the cloud and could not find them unless she happened to step on them.
1252121.title: Too Slow

choices: Go back to the other tigers.
12522.content:
Felines are not known for their loyalty. The tigress was still hungry and even though the handlers had always been her friends, they were currently the size of food. She lowered her head to them and savored the scent of their fear. Then she took one of them in her jaws.

Some of the handlers wailed in fear, some tried to flee, and one just fainted when they saw the lump descended the throat of the tiger. The ones that tried to flee saw an orange blur as the tigress quickly batted them back to the rest of the group. The tigress spotted the human that had passed out and swallowed him next. The handlers could only sit there and watch as the tiger's rough tongue wrapped them up one by one and swallowed each in turn. Her reactions were just to fast for them to escape.

The tigress was still far from full. Most of the humans had fled the zoo by now. She thought about going after them to fill her belly. Then again she would hate to leave her cub alone with just a male for too long. Decision time.

The only weapons people had available to them bounced harmlessly of the reptiles scaly hide. The crocodile's invulnerability, its size, and its ability to casually devour the cities population made the croc seem god-like to the humans.

When the crocodile had finished gorging on the population it found a place to sun itself on the outskirts of the city. That area was also where many of the people were trying to escape the city. It tried to thrash about and get loose. Nothing budged. Its tail moved fine but that was it. The crocodile did not notice that its thick tail had crushed the work crews that were trying to secure its tail. The crocodile started to panic and then remembered that it could shrink or grow out of its bonds. It did not want to shrink since it may become even more vulnerable to such traps. So it began to grow.

The humans that had been gathered around the crocodile's body began to flee its expanding body. The growth was to fast for many and they were crushed beneath the expanding crocodile. That also went unnoticed by the crocodile, it was just happy that its restraints began to snap. The crocodile stopped its growth when it was 1600 feet long and the blind folds fell from its eyes.

The crocodile noticed some fleeing humans and quickly snapped them up. It wondered if they had been responsible for restraining it but quickly dismissed that notion. It was ridiculous to think that such puny creatures could do that to itself.

The increase in size left it hungry again. It was time to feed. The crocodile went in search of another food source.

When the crocodile began scooping people up in its jaws it got nearly as much dirt and debris as humans. It did not mind though, the debris would help to digest the meal.

The people who had started to flee first could not help but stop and look back at the massacre. They watched the crocodile twist its head sideways and take a bite out of a crowd of people. Then it would tip its head back like a bird drinking water and watch a small lump descend its throat. When the crowd would thin out the crocodile would walk forward crushing some beneath its feat and the rest were crushed by its belly, which was dragging along the ground.

This process continued for over an hour before the crocodile was finally satisfied. When the humans noticed the crocodile pause they thought they might escape death. Unfortunately for them the crocodile had spotted a place to digest its meal and they were in the way.

It was not to far for the croc, so it just dragged itself over without bothering to stand all the way up. People tried to get out of the way of the approaching wall of scales but the crocodile was moving to fast for them. Not only were the bodies of the people crushed, but after being caught under the entire length of the crocodile they were reduced into a fine paste that left no pieces large enough to be identified as ever having been human.

The crocodile was not ready to sleep yet as it began to sun itself. There was still a whole day ahead of it and the crocodile had to decide what to do now that it was full.

Those who were not crushed by the debris had to struggle to keep from being chewed by teeth that were larger than their homes had been. The horses did not notice the small amounts of meat being added to their diet.

Some people tried to flee their homes. That was not much safer. Some people were still picked up by the horses leathery lips. The others found that they had to dodge the large number of hooves all around them. Only a handful of people managed to avoid being turned into red stains beneath the horses hooves.

Hunger satisfied the horses decided to rest. The people left beneath the horses were fortunate that horses sleep standing up or else there would have been no survivors. The humans could only look up at the bloated bellies that were blocking out the sun. They were just insects standing in the shadow of titans.

They had surprised her before though and she did want to take any chances with them. She sat down on the area, crushing any human resistance beneath her massive posterior. She also looked for the flying object she believed had killed one of her herd mates but was unable to locate it. The horses were too large to eat anything, but the humans had proven themselves too dangerous to shrink themselves. The female could shrink all humans and return to a more reasonable size or she could try to grow the planet to the horses new scale.

to shrink all predators and usher in a golden age for herbivores

The human race, once the top the food chain are reduced to the size of insects in mere seconds. Once positive that all humans are no longer a threat to her race, the horse slowly begins to shrink herself and the other horses down to their original size. She looks around at the ground and can see small black dots running away from her and the others. She takes a closer look and discovers that the dots are in fact, humans.

The horse is pleased with herself and announces to the others that the human threat is no more. The horses begin to cheer when one of them steps forward to ask about the other animals, such as predators and other herbivores. The horse thinks for a little while then decides...
152221111111.title: Shrink humans and themselves.

choices: Switch to one of the human survivors
1522211111111.content:
The horse concentrated, and shrunk every animal down to 5,000 times their original height, the same size as the humans. As an act of mercy, she also shrunk down the structures and cities to the same size. Humans were now a measly 0.8 millimeters in height, with the horses appearing to be nearly 2.4 miles tall. Satisfied with her work, the horse returns to her herd to celebrate becoming the rulers of the earth.

Life was a nightmare for humanity. Because of their now minuscule size, retrieving resources such as food was difficult, unless someone was lucky enough to shrink near a fruit tree. Even then, harvests were dangerous. The skyscraper-sized fruit was difficult to mine, and at any second it could drop from the tree, or worse, a hungry horse could be walking by. The equine behemoths didn't make an effort to cause trouble for the humans, but neither did they bother to protect them. The tiny pink apes were smaller than most insects were, and they rarely even noticed them. Cities would lay unharmed for months, until the fateful day when a horse decides to walk through, graze on the enormous grass, or leave a mountainous brown "present". Life as they knew it was forever changed.
1522211111111.title: Horses: Masters of Earth

15222111111111.content:
The horses were growing in numbers over the years, and after a while, they had even forgotten that humans had even existed. They were the largest creatures on the planet. Other animals still existed, and were the only reason that humans still existed in their diminutive stature. The horses had shrunk the cities with them, so they were able to live like they had before. For the most part. and as such, the humans were forgotten about.

A herd of horses had been wandering, in fact the same mare that had gained the power over size was in this small herd of five. They had moved away from the usual grazing area to let it refresh is supply for a while and had taken of in a direction that they had not gone yet. Looking around the clearing, they noticed that the meadow that they had found was lush with grass to eat for a long while, but it also had a rather large area of dirt that looked high quality. Unknown to the horses this was an area where the shrinking of cities had pulled each of them closer to each other. Due to this the ground around them had broken up. In this patch lay more than a few dozen cities. Most from the old days, some actually made over time to help with the population increase.

But the horses would never look close enough to see them.

The horses began to graze, splitting up to make sure they didn't wittle away at one spot too quickly. They found the spot to be quite comfortable, and began chatting amongst themselves as they would to pass time. The mare was not in this group, and was rather over by the strange spot on the ground that was a few body lengths wide. In it she spotted a few of these strange gray spots. The spots looked to be around an inch around, so she was rather curious.
15222111111111.title: Forgotten Bugs

choices: Forget about it, and have fun
152221111111111.content:
Looking down, she glanced at her herd, making sure they weren't watching her. She leaned down slightly, and took a small sniff of the gray spot. She felt the dirt and other tiny things rush into her nose, and she let her tongue out to lick at her nose slightly. It smelled weird yet not bad, and her tongue tasted a faint salty tinge to it, something she was beginning to miss. She let her tongue drop to the dirt, and gently press against the city. Tapping it lightly, she tasted it slowly, feeling it crumble below her tongue as she ran her tongue slowly over it. Her taste buds loved the taste, but hated the dirt that got in the way. She let her tongue go flush against the ground, burying the city in an avalanche of warm slimy tongue. Dragging her tongue a bit, she collected a fair bit of the crushed city on it, and retracted her tongue and swished the treat in her mouth, trying to get what flavor she could from it.

Lifting her head up, she swallowed and looked down, her thoughts were simple:
152221111111111.title: Destruction Amusement

1522211111111112.content: She looked down at the spot where she licked, not a trace of the gray spot anywhere to be seen. She shook her head slightly, deciding that the spots, although good, were not worth the effort. She could grow the spots, and make them easier to eat. Or she can make them smaller, and just ignore them.
1522211111111112.title: Bigger or Smaller?

15222111111111122.content:
She shook her head, and simply let her power pulse outwards for a second. Shrinking the already small gray spots into things she could easily mistake for pebbles. She walked into the dirt area, fully intent on sunbathing with the warm dirt at her hooves. She knew full well that in doing so would crush a few of the spots, but she could barely tell where they were anymore, so she didn't care.

Below, the people in the cities were already in a panic at the appearance of the horses, let alone what they witnessed. From a city being eaten to being shrunk smaller, watching the horse above them ignore them completely.

Her front hoof took out one right off the bat, as it was like she was aiming for it. It overshadowed the city for a second before crushing it instantly. The dirt beneath them compacting from the weight even as they were squished to an unrecognizable paste. Another fell to her back hoof, in a similar fashion, the only difference was that they got to look up and see the monolith above them move away before they saw the hoof descending on their world. The rest watched with baited breath as she took another step forward. She didn't crush any with that one, but she did stop after it. They watched her bend her back legs, as she made to sit down. The cities underneath her could only watch as the mare above them sat down. Her rear spreading slightly as the movement made the flesh jiggle slightly. Her rump made contact with the ground, and with it, more than three cities found there end under the warm plot of the mare. With a wiggle, she made sure that not a soul survived under her rump. She then proceeded to lower the front half of her body, then laying more on her side. The few citied underneath her could see everything, as she blocked out the sun for them. Only for their last vision to be brown hairs. Six cities only saw a wall of brown flesh the mare lay back, crushing them easily under her hips and side.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
The mare sat down on the dirt, the warmth of the dirt making her sigh softly to herself. She felt her rump sink into the sand, and she shimmied it when she felt a light tickle on one of her cheeks. Satisfied, she lay forward, feeling the dirt beneath her crumble and give as she lay down. Flopping onto her side, she let another sigh out, as she lay there soaking in the sun. Her skin tingled, and her fur gently swayed in the wind. She leaned up after a minute and looked up at her herd. Thinking about letting them know about the spot, she focused on one of the spots from before. She could only see it since she was so close, so she lifted a hoof. She made a small circle around it and gently plopped her hoof on it, feeling no resistance as she crushed whatever it was.

She had made up her mind:
15222111111111122.title: Smaller ignorance

choices: Sam, a 19 year old living in a city on an apple tree.
15222111111112.content: As the horses and herbivores enjoy a life of peace and harmony, the tiny humans scratch out a living wherever they can survive. Here's one possible choice:
15222111111112.title: Switch to one of the human survivors

choices: The sound of a massive creature approaching
152221111111121.content:
Sam looked out the window of his room. Life was...difficult. Very difficult. He and the rest of Branchford (that was really a stupid name, he thought) had been living...well, surviving for nearly a decade now. He remembers the day the entire town shrank. Most of the people were content with living on the ground, until the day a massive horse strode past the town. It didn't get anywhere near, but that was enough to convince everyone they needed a safer location. Thankfully, the Ferguson's apple orchard was just by the town square, so it only took a week of travel to reach it. After another week of climbing, they reached a thick branch with plenty of massive, juicy apples for food. Each summer, half the town would carefully climb onto one of the red orbs, and spend the next few months harvesting and mining the fruit. They have to work quickly, since the apple could fall at any time, and the waxy surface makes it extra treacherous during rain or heavy wind.

Sam was one of the apple miners, and this was his second season collecting food for the town. He exits the small barracks built near the apple's stem, and walks past the mines. He reached the ridge of the apple, and looks at the rising sun in the horizon. As he turns to head to his mine, the ground shakes, and a distance boom could be heard. What was it?
152221111111121.title: Sam, a 19 year old living in a city on an apple...

1522211111111211.content: The thunderous boom is followed by another, and another. Soon, the shape of a city-sized horse appears. It lumbers towards the tree, each hoof step shaking the ground more and more. Eventually it's standing directly under the tree. Sam watches, partly in fear, partly in wonder, as the ginormous behemoth's head swings...
1522211111111211.title: The sound of a massive creature approaching

15222111111112112.content:
Sam watched as the lips wrap around a low-hanging apple, gently plucking it from the branch and giving everyone a full view of the feeding. Fortunately for the city, that apple wasn't being mined: it wasn't ripe enough and far too low. As the cacophony of chewing booms from underneath, everyone holds their breath as the titan stands below. Finally, the beast swallows and lumbers off, leaving everyone to sigh in relief. Well, that is until the sound of another horse approaches.

This horse appears much larger: while the first could barely reach the lower limbs, this one had to duck its head, its mane brushing through the leaves. A hazel eye locks onto the apple, and the city knew they were in trouble. As everyone raced to the flimsy elevators, the smell of grass fills the air as the maw rises up. A massive tongue reaches out and tips the apple. Sam falls flat on his face and slides towards the edge. The edge disappears, and below Sam sees he's about to land on...
15222111111112112.title: Up, to grab an apple

152221111111121121.content: Below Sam was the vast muzzle of the horse. He lands on the leathery ground somewhere between the two nostrils. In the distance, a pair of enormous lips part as they encircle the apple. Sam can only watch in horror as his friends and family are pulled into this beast's maw. The thunderous sound of crunches fill the air as the fruit is pulverized, along with everyone on it. The muzzle swings back down, and what was the sky is now replaced with a long fall to the ground. Sam holds on for dear life, but as the horse chews it shakes its head. Does Sam stay on the muzzle?
152221111111121121.title: On its muzzle

choices: Sam gets swept off the apple
The apple falls off the tree
1522211111111212.content: Sam looks the other way, and notices a massive grey wall filling the horizon. A storm was coming, and fast! Bells began to ring as people on bullhorns gave orders to evacuate the apple. Unfortunately, the storm hits before anyone can get to safety. What happens next?
1522211111111212.title: A sudden storm

15222111111112122.content:
As massive raindrops begin to fall, heavy winds buffet the tree, shaking the branch and apple. Sam just made it into his barracks, a much safer location than outside. He watches an unfortunate worker get sucked off the waxy surface and out to oblivion. Suddenly, a loud creaking noise emanates from the stem. The apple wasn't due to fall for another month, but this early storm has put extra stress on the wooden support, and now it is degrading. Sam looks on helplessly as a large crack races across the only thing keeping the apple attached to the tree. He runs into his closet, bracing for the fall. One final crack, and everything goes into free fall. A few seconds later, the force of the impact knocks out Sam, and everything turns to black.

Sam wakes up, partially covered by rubble. Thankfully, the storm seems to have passed, so at least he doesn't have to worry about getting blasted by a water asteroid. He pushes the debris off of him, and climbs to the top of the wreckage. The apple sat in a massive puddle, water stretching out for miles in every direction. Only the massive blades of grass poke out of the expansive lake. Seeing other workers, Sam runs up to the group.

"Hey, are you all that survived?"

"As far as we can tell. The foreman got stuck outside when the storm hit, I haven't seen him since. Shit, that means I'm in charge. What do we do?"

"Well, we should focus on getting back up the tree as soon as possible. We've got rope and wood; we could build some rafts and start heading towards the trunk."
15222111111112122.title: The apple falls off the tree

choices: The one with all the power, and she's feeling playful...
152221111111121222.content: The thundering hoofsteps weren't noticed by the tiny workers, as they mixed too well with the distant rolling thunder. However, they definitely felt the earthquakes as a massive horse appears over the grass. Sam and the others scream in terror; this was the worst place to be when a hungry giant comes. To their dismay, this horse was...
152221111111121222.title: A hungry horse appears

choices: Take them with her as she travels.
Shrink them even smaller than before and see how they react.
1522211111111212222.content:
The female horse had been enjoying a decade of peace with her herd. Grassy fields spread all throughout the world, leaving plenty for them to feed on. Humans, animals, even insects were all shrunk to a near invisible size, giving the equines full dominance over all the land. Yes, life was quiet and uneventful.

Too uneventful. The horse huffs, it's been a while since something interesting has popped up. Human settlements have been harder and harder to find, all the ones in the open have been unknowingly crushed, and the rest are hiding too well. The female horse walks under an apple tree, slurping up some water from a puddle underneath it. She notices a shiny red apple, and stretches her neck out to grab a bite. That's when she notices the tiny specks atop the fruit. A quick sniff confirmed it: these were humans.

Sam and the others were frozen in fear. A monstrous pink worm slithered out of the horse's mouth, lapping up a pool's worth of water in a single slurp. The drinking horse unknowingly created 'small' waves, which traveled toward the apple. A few workers were busy lashing together rafts at the shore, and didn't notice the massive surge until it was too late. The crashing wave sucked them out into the open water, where they were taken into the horse's mouth. Sam knew there was no survival for them. Suddenly, the horse's eye looked forward and locked onto the red apple. The massive maw rose above the water, and loomed towards them. The muzzle stopped just an inch away from the terrified workers, who watched in slight confusion. Before anyone could act, a short burst of wind sucked another worker off the fruit and into the cavernous nostril. As he lay on the ground, Sam noticed that the world was getting smaller.

The horse grew the apple to about ten times its size, and got a better look at the humans. They were all wearing the same clothing, and seemed to have built structures out of the apple. Mildly impressed, she thinks about what to do with her new playthings.
1522211111111212222.title: The mare with the power

choices: At the tree's roots, opposite of the horse
At a continental hoof, right next to the horse
15222111111112122222.content:
The female horse always loved to see what humans did when at their wit's end. She concentrates on the apple and its passengers, letting it slowly shrink down. She continues past their original size, eventually turning them microscopic. Thanks to her gift, she was still able to see the infinitesimal humans. Satisfied with her work, she lowers herself down, resting her head in a way that allowed her to watch them and see what they do.

Sam and the others looked around in confusion. They had grown huge! Well, about half an inch, but that made them larger than any human alive. Wait, did the horse do this? As Sam turned toward the slightly less terrifying horse, he watched her watch them. The beast closed her eyes, and the world slowly returned to its massive size. A small gust of wind sent the apple sailing across the ocean. However, as it travels they notice the world, including the apple, is still getting bigger. The blades of grass become towering citadels, each dozens of miles tall. The lake-sized puddle is now an ocean; luckily for them the now massive apple was drifting towards the shore. The insects that were once insects are now almost twice their height, lazily flying around the enormous fruit. A massive earthquake rings out, shaking every man to his core. They slowly turn to see the horse, lying down next to the puddle, with a godlike eye watching them. The equine was originally 'only' 2 miles tall, but now she was thousands of miles in height. She might as well have been a planet at this size.

Sam and the others cry out in despair; survival was difficult when you were barely a millimeter tall, but now? They weren't even half a micrometer tall! They'd be lucky if another human ever sees them. As they turn to one another and fearfully wonder what to do, the ground lurches sideways and sends them sliding off the apple. Their massive "ship" had reached shore, but where were they?
15222111111112122222.title: Shrink them even smaller than before and see ho...

152221111111121222221.content: The group of workers, now down to a dozen men, stand up and shake the nanoscopic dust off themselves. They turn and look up at the monolithic tree root, laying a few miles away from their location. A few spires of grass stand tall, waving in the air from an unseen gale. Luckily the wind was blocked at this level, or they'd be sent flying. With little other plans for help, they decide to try and return to their home. It may be a long shot, but that's the only way they'd ever get to safety. Grabbing what supplies they have (and as many chunks of apple as possible), they set out towards the massive root.
152221111111121222221.title: At the tree's roots, opposite of the horse

1522211111111212222212.content: The ground starts shaking, much less than the horse caused, though. A shape emerges from behind one hundred-mile-tall blade of grass, what was it?
1522211111111212222212.title: A tiny giant

choices: She twitches her hoof, sending them flying
152221111111121222222.content:
Right in front of Sam was a colossal wall of rock hard keratin. It seemed to stretch for a hundred miles, before turning into an even larger leg, which itself became the planetary body of the massive horse. Sam gulps nervously, he can see bits of grass stuck on the hoof, each one miles in size. The group huddles together and discusses what to do. The horse seems to have shrunk them, maybe they can find a way to contact it? With few options left, they decide to scale the beast.

The climb is relatively easy for them. They're used to scaling vertical walls and waxy fruit, this is a walk in the park. Well, it would be if it also wasn't the size of a state. They brace themselves as the horse nickers, a thunderous boom that nearly shatters their eardrums.

The horse watched the specks land on shore, right beside her rear left hoof. They moved out of sight, but she could feel them climbing up the appendage. She nickers in excitement; this should be interesting to watch. Eventually, a dozen colorful specks appear at the top of the hoof, back in view of the horse.

Sam was the first to reach the top. As he did so, he saw a massive eye watch him from thousands of miles away. That horse could clearly see him, what was she up to? As the others climb up behind him...
152221111111121222222.title: At a continental hoof, right next to the horse

1522211111111212222221.content:
The horse continues to watch her microbial toys scale her leg, now passing the fetlock and reaching her skinny leg.

To the intrepid men, the fetlock was a thick rainforest that nearly turned them around. Sam almost tripped down the side, only for his colleague to catch him. All the while, the thunderous booming of the horse's heartbeat made communication nearly impossible. Eventually they reached the other side, and found hundreds of miles of leg, an insane distance to cross. As if that wasn't enough, a shadow zipped overhead to herald some new monolithic problem. It came from a 2-mile...
1522211111111212222221.title: The horse watches patiently

15222111111112122222212.content:
The ball of water impacted a distant hoof with a massive boom. Sam nervously looked up and realized that the blue sky was now grey. Another raindrop confirms it: their nightmare is about to get far worse.

The horse also notices the oncoming rain, but to her it's just a mere nuisance. She flicks her ear after a single drop splashes it, then returns to watching how the humans react.

It was like a battlefield, only the enemy was dropping mortars the size of cities. Sam and the others ran as hard as they could and tried to avoid the massive drops, but it was all up to luck. And eventually that runs out. Sam looked up in time to watch as a droplet landed directly behind them, exploding in a lake of water. The impact sent him and his friends flying...
15222111111112122222212.title: raindrop, it's another storm!

152221111111121222222121.content: Thousands of miles pass in a heartbeat as the tiny group find themselves plastered onto the wet surface of the horse's...
152221111111121222222121.title: Onto the horse's head

choices: They make it to the top
1522211111111212222221211.content:
James and the others find themselves on a cratered, black landscape of massive mesas and deep canyons. The entire surface is covered with a slimy, sticky glaze that keeps the microbial people adhered to the wall. Miles away, a hurricane of wind blows in and out of a dark chasm. A patch of brown can be seen in the distance, and below? A thousand mile drop. The tiny humans all cover their ears as a cacophony of thunder explodes underneath them.

The horse nickered to herself in joy. The tiny humans got lucky and landed right on her nose. They're quite close to their own end goal, but that's when the fun really starts. She stands up and walks underneath the tree to shield her passengers from the ongoing storm.

Climbing is a nightmare. The group is now scaling a hundred miles of sticky black leather. All the while, they can look down and see that their drop has increase as the horse stood up. Spurred on, they keep going to reach the top of the monolithic muzzle.
1522211111111212222221211.title: Nose

1522211111111212222222.content:
The female horse huffs tiredly, involuntarily twitching her legs.

Sam and the rest of the party cover their ears when the massive horse huffed, which left them unable to react when the hoof swung up by a whole mile. This pathetically insignificant movement threw them right into a small breeze, which scattered the terrified humans. One got thrown backward into the water, where he'll drown long before reaching shore. A handful flew past a nostril a hundred miles wide, which unknowingly sucked them in with a single breath. All but one died on impact with nose hairs, but one "lucky" man merely got stuck in a sea of mucus, doomed to be sucked further inside at any moment. Others landed among the horse's tail, which was safe until the massive ropes twitched, crushing them between strands wider than redwoods. The only survivor was Sam, who managed to only fly a thousand miles up the horse's leg.

Unfortunately for him, the horse had lost track of the tiny humans. Without her playthings, there's no reason to stay here. She grabs the apple before standing up and walking back to her herd. Meanwhile, Sam clung for dear life on a massive hair, each step swinging him back and forth a thousand miles. After hundreds of steps, Sam finds himself...
1522211111111212222222.title: She twitches her hoof, sending them flying

15222111111112122222221.content: The planetary movement was too much for him. Step by step, his blistering hands slipped just a bit more. It was inevitable, really. Sam screamed in terror as the monolithic leg swung forward, sucking him along. The air current sent him plummeting towards...
15222111111112122222221.title: Losing his grip

152221111111121222222211.content:
Sam hit a wall of green, hard. He regained his senses just in time to watch the continental horse lumber away, each step rocking him to his core. A moment later and he was left in silence, with the only noise being the rumbling grass in the wind.

Sam didn't know it at the time, but his fate was sealed. Climbing down the blade of grass would take longer than Mt. Everest, and during the weeks of travel a wandering horse became hungry. The last thing Sam saw was a maw that could swallow up England without even noticing.
152221111111121222222211.title: A blade of grass

152221111111121222222212.content: The field of hairs filled Sam's view, who instinctively held his arms out. He crashed into one of the massive hairs, several times thicker than a redwood tree. As the horse continued to walk, the hair swayed back and forth, threatening to launch Sam out into the unknown. The other hairs clash and mesh at random, with several almost knocking Sam loose for a thousand-mile plunge. Try as he might, Sam can't do anything but hope his luck stays with him.
152221111111121222222212.title: The horse's tail

choices: The horse, who's finally noticed him
15222111111112122222222.content:
The horse reached a small grove, where her large family lived. After taking a few minutes to graze, she laid down. Some of her relatives approach her as they all take a nap.

Despite all odds, Sam survived the horse's walk, ending with the leg tilting sideways. He can tell the horse has stopped, and decides to continue his ascent. It's a bit easier at this angle, and he easily reaches the top of the equine's back. A shadow swings above him, as a massive muzzle looms overhead. Each nostril was big enough to suck in any city, filled with hairs that were bigger than any tree, or even man-made buildings. Who's was it?
15222111111112122222222.title: Still hanging on

choices: She missed her rider and decided to keep Sam safe.
He was a reminder of humanity's evil.  This can't end well.
She noticed him, she just didn't care.  He was just human after all.
152221111111121222222221.content:
A blast of hot, strangely sweet breath assaulted Sam's senses, literally blowing his off his feet as the wave of hurricane force air hit him with a single SNORT from the horse.

He froze as he stared upwards, his eyes fighting to focus on the immensity of the muzzle that hovered overhead, keeping him cast in shadow, the horse's dark eyes seeming to focus on him with impossible ease, given how small he was compared to each and every strand of fur that covered her endless form.

A nicker of acknowledgement cut through the air like thunder, so loud it may as well have been a bomb blast, Sam's ears ringing as he fell backwards against a strand of fur.

Clearly she had noticed him. But what was she waiting for?

What were her intentions for him?
152221111111121222222221.title: The horse, who's finally noticed him

choices: Jenny, a 34 year old surviving on one of the horses
152221111111122.title: Other

choices: Humanity decides to turn the tables
The horses realize what's going on
1522211111112.content:
The horse concentrates, shrinking all predators to the same tiny size as humans. Soon enough, they were all 20,000 times smaller. A human was no more than 200 micrometers tall, and to them the horses were a titanic 24 miles tall. The herbivores enjoyed their peace, to the horror of humanity. They did their best to survive, settling under trees and in the massive abandoned homes. If the unaware herbivores didn't eat them with the grass, the dinosaur-sized ants would. They had to adapt if they wanted to survive.

With much effort and with very little time, they managed to capture and tame a handful of the now 500 foot tall flies, using them as massive mounts. As a last ditch effort, they used the insects to evacuate the land and settle on the animals. It was difficult and very slow:the massive farm animals could feel the still tiny bugs, and smash them and their masters with gigantic tails. The occasional flick of their miles-long tail would send dozens plummeting to their doom, either to fall for miles or be swept up in the tail hairs.

Within a few years, humanity found some peace at last. They resided in settlements in the nooks and crannies of the gods, living off of sweat and skin flakes. They even managed to domesticate the 60 foot mites that lived on the horses. Still, the occasional disaster struck: if a town got too big and the herbivore noticed, they'd get rubbed into oblivion. They straddled a dangerous line, and had to ensure their towns didn't get big enough to notice.

Life wasn't perfect, but they managed
1522211111112.title: Pax Equus

choices: Show mercy and grow them a little bigger
15222111111122.content: The horses have started to notice odd marks on themselves. Speckled, gray areas pop up on flat surfaces, and emit minuscule lights at night. The original female takes a closer look, and realizes they're the microscopic cities of the humans. They must have found a way on top of them, and are now living in their fur! This particular city watches in horror as a titanic eye sweeps over them, clearly able to see them. The horse begins to think again, maybe she should shrink them further, and end them once and for all. Then again, she could give them a tiny bit of mercy. After all, they've survived for a couple years on nothing but sweat and skin flakes!
15222111111122.title: The horses realize what's going on

152221111111222.content:
The tiny cities watch first with confusion, then panic as their world grows bigger yet again. Soon enough, they are only 100 nanometers in height. A single hair is almost a mile in diameter now, not to mention the horses that are now the size of a planet each. The mites they used to tame are now 10 miles tall, completely unaware of the microscopic humans around them.

It was a disaster for humanity. Anything and everything was lethal to them. Any humans in an open area would get swept up by hurricane-force winds, scattered throughout the enormous world. A stray hair falling down could crush an entire expedition party. Flies and mites larger than mountains would land and feed on the skin, unknowingly picking up dozens of humans alongside their meal. If they survived the feeding, they'd be crushed by the ocean of hair that was the horse's tail.

If any humans managed to land safely on the ground, they'd find an even more hostile world. They were too small to outrun anything that could kill. Lake-sized crushed dozens and drowned even more. Snails and slugs would accidentally crush survivors under their mucus-covered bodies. Occasionally the enormous maw of a horse or other herbivore appear overhead, and slurp up the pathetic specks along with a mouthful of grass. Afterward, the survivors would have to sit in fear and pray one of the monolithic hooves don't step on them, or that the animal doesn't drop a brown mountain on top of them.

Humanity would continue to live for a few more years, but nowhere was safe. It was only a matter of time before something killed them. Really, they never had a chance.
152221111111222.title: Shrink them down

152221111112.content:
The horses get together and decide what to do. They come to a group consensus. They like towering over all the other creatures on the planet. So the female horse attempts to grow the entire planet, well most of it anyway. The voice had said that she could grow anything and this would certainly be a test of that.

As the horse concentrated the Earth began to balloon in size. Grass, wheat, and other plants that horses find delicious grew to over 15 miles in height. People around the world watched in wonder as grass began to tower over mountains. She did not bother growing mountains because the things would get in the way of their runs, trees too.

Many of the other giant animals were grateful for this as well. They had begun to wonder what they would eat as they quickly worked through the available food supply. The female horse did not want to accidentally crush the animals she had grown before, so she made them as tall as the grass.

This new world order was shock for humanity. Every time a rabbit, cow, deer, or other herbivore double the size of a mountain passed through a city it would be left devastated. When a horse would pass through a city, it would simply cease to exist, either crushed beneath a hoof or accidentally eaten along with the vegetation that surrounded them. In a short time humans had gone from the dominant species on Earth and been reduced to the status of ants in a giants playground. Humanity...
152221111112.title: Power Shift

1522211111122.content:
Human civilization was unable to sustain itself. Routes of transportation were destroyed faster than they could be made. Means of obtaining resources were crushed by careless giants. The movements of horses caused maps to be rendered useless as they constantly crushed mountains and generated new ones with each step.

After a few weeks various cults started to appear. They proclaimed the horses to be gods and the other herbivores to be lesser gods, or demons. Either way humanity was helpless before the titans and could only pray they would not wind up under a hoof or paw.

The rider on the female horse had long since been forgotten by the god-like horse. He had been reduced to the status of a louse on the horse's back. To survive he had to eat dead skin flakes and drink her sweat. It might have been easier on him to have been crushed by the deer. He sometimes had thoughts of climbing down the horse, but whenever he was able to look over the side of the horse he was never able to see the ground and decided against it.

The horses never even noticed the devastation they caused and soon forgot about humanity. The other animals occasionally noticed swarms of humans, but only payed as much attention to them as they did any other bugs. With no predators it was the golden age of the herbivore.

The female horse eventually grew bored and...
1522211111122.title: Gods And Demons

choices: the foals says "bet you can't make me as big as the earth"
"Do me. Do me" says another animal
15222111111221.content:
Many years pasted. Free from predators and well fed the horse had many children and more then a hundred grandchildren. Even the newborn horses could crush a mountain with a single step. At the slightest hint of overcrowding the earth was grown once again. Herds of thousands of horse roamed the endless plains.

The horse was telling one of her grandchildren of how horses became the biggest creatures and after being told of bit where the whole earth is grown asks "so you can grow anything grandma"

"Yes"

"Anything??" ask the increasing exciting foal

"Yes"

"What about this rock" said the foal point to a small pebble that was actually a broken off mountain. The pebble sudden became a thousand miles tall.

"And this grass", the grass loomed over them like mightly redwood trees and then shrunk down

"What about that cloud", the tiny cloud filled the sky

"what about this worm" the worm was suddenly as tall as a horse

Several hours were spent growing various creepy crawlies, some of which turned out to tbe the long forgotten carnivores (which were immediately shrunk again) even a few humans where grown, but never higher then the foals knees, which they stroked eager to please there gods.

The foal then asked "now grow me." In a flash the foal was so tall even his hoof was taller then grandma. Grandma by then was so good at growing things that nothing would be hurt or broken unless she wanted it too, which she didn't. Even humans were indestructable now, unless they were mean.
15222111111221.title: grew the horses even more.

choices: Bigger, granny put to much power into it
152221111112211.content:
"Wow grandma this is amazing!" cried the foal in excitement as it trampled all around. The earth shook beneath every step, but nothing broke or gave way. Though the effects of the foals little trip could be felt for hundreds of miles.

"I'm glad you approve little....er big one!" the older horse said smiling up at her grandchild.

The foal looked up and saw the clouds in the sky and wondered just what they might taste like. Were they like cotton candy, icicles, snow? The little foal didn't know but the certainly wanted to know.

"Grandma is this the best you can do? I wanna be even bigger!!" the foal shouted.

" I'd say you're plenty big enough wouldn't you?" The grandma replied

"OH I See, this is the limit huh?" The foal replied playfully. "Its okay that is fine if you can't make me any bigger, I understand."
"EXCUSE ME! I'll have you know I don't have limits you little young'in!" The older horse shouted.
"I'm Little now?" the foal asked arching the brow above one eye
"Well compared to THIS you are!" The older horse shouted and immediately concentrated and double her young grandchild's size nearly instantly.

The foal shot into the air, rising higher and higher, watching the landscape shrink and the delicious clouds get closer. Suddenly the growth stopped. From most normal horses perspectives on this new world the Foal was now nearly 300 ft, though given the average of a horse now size the young creature was actually much larger. But on this newly enlarged planet perspective was everything.

"How's that?" Said the grandma
"Pffft, I can barely tell I grew." replied the foal

"Yeah more more, I want to eat...er see everything" the foal cut itself off mid sentence not wanting to give away its goals of chomping down on the clouds far above.
The foal passed 800 feet and finally stopped growing at 900 feet tall. Many other horses had taken note of the little one's growth spurt and while some worried, none said anything they new their matron was in control.

"There you go little one, now that's big." replied the grandma nodding her head, she was barely 1/10 the size of the foals hoof now.
"Oh I'm sorry was I growing I couldn't tell." the foal said as it sat down. halving its current standing height.
"Why you incorrigible little whipper snapper! You want big I'll show you big!" The older horse responded, while thinking to herself how she hadn't had this much fun in years. Sure she grew and shrank things but not to many seemed to actually like it, they just sorta accepted it.

The little foal looked down, "Oh yeah tiny you couldn't grow a fly!!"

"More? well if that's what you want" Grandma horse replied, and the foals size began to expand.

In one chomp the foal cleared a few hundred clouds, then 100 miles became 200, 300, 400...Suddenly the foal stepped forward and chomped down on even more fluffy treats, and 400 miles became 500, then 600, still the foal ate, and grew, and ate and grew. Bigger and bigger with every bite 600 miles became a memory and 1,200 miles a reality.

"MORE GRANNY, MORE! I WANNA CLEAR THE WHOLE SKY!!" The mega sized foal roared its shouts shaking the ground and rocking the oceans.
"Little one are you that hungry?"
"Pshh, granny, the pebble you grew earlier reached this size. i wanna be big, real big. I bet you can't make me as big as...the continent....no as big as the WHOLE PLANET!!"

Oh no, the dolphin had literally made the world and its oceans bigger to accommodate the new sea life. Small land massed the shark could see from here probably the human lands.

But that didn't matter, yet. they would be food soon enough, everything would be food. The shark approached the shrimp cluster, each one barely able to defend itself, but each nearly 75 miles large. The shark ate, and ate and ate. then he grew....120 miles became 130, 260, 520....the shark gorged itself and in the end it surfaced content only to find its next meal be it continents, or krakens...or dolphin...

In the end the shark had grown to be....

155.content:
Mother Nature tells her mirror to looks for a bear. So then a Image appears in the mirror of a bear. Its laying down in a zoo. Then a ghostly figure appears in front of the bear.
Mother Nature said, I am here to give you the power to make yourself, other animal, and people any size you want.
The bear said, Why should I believe you!
Because I am Mother Nature!
Why not test your power on a yourself!
So I can make myself bigger right!
The bear look at his mate and cub.
The bear thinks of his mate growing bigger.
His mate starts to grow.
He look at her as she grows in front him and his cub. When she stops growing she is 20 feet tall on all fours.
Then he thinks of his cub growing bigger.
And the cub grows to the same size as him.
Then he make himself grow to to the same size that his mate is.
